intro: Thesium spartioides, commonly known as the desert broom, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low, sprawling growth habit and dense clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant has adapted to harsh environments through features such as succulent stems and reduced leaf surfaces. Its flowers are typically arranged in compact inflorescences and bloom during the cooler months. Thesium spartioides is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
